ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were lifting their robe while walking in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not lift my robe while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.4_0: he should lift up his robe while walking in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, lifts his robe on one or both sides while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.13_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk9:1.14_0: The ninth training rule is finished.
